name: Green Garden Village
address: 216 Grand St, New York, NY 10013, USA

reviews.text: The staff here knows how to make every guest feel important. Every staff member showed professionalism. I'd heard praise for Green Garden Village and now understand why. You can enjoy superb food without excessive prices. This spot has become my go-to choice.

Lots of locals hopping in here to grab food to go gives GGV insta street cred. The noodle soups are a perfect pick me up on a cool day.  Mild broth, perfect noodles, fresh veg and a side of immaculate soy sauce chicken make for a simple yet profound meal.  And at 9 dollars, the value is a 10 out of 10.

Super lecker und authentisch. In Deutschland  plus Schweiz und Ã–sterreich kann man kaum gutes Chinesen finden, das auch so gut machen kann.

I got the sesame chicken with white rice and it was very good. Quick service and the price was reasonable for a lunch plate which was around $11. Without the lunch price though it would be close to $20 which is insane and I would never pay that. Good take out spot.

The waiter with glasses gave awful service. He was cold and rude the whole time. All he did was bring my food and take away the empty plate. I paid for a meal under $10, and he kept my change from the cashier and then had the nerve to ask for a tip. It was totally out of line.

Tips are for great service, not for lazy, greedy behavior.
Beef chow fun is tasty, requested no bean sprouts. Pork rice rolls are good. Would come back to eat again; only 1 unisex bathroom.

I think they're just hit and miss on the quality. Duck order was thinner on the breast meat. Strangely the Chinese Broccoli/ gai lan order was all stem and no leaves, like the tops were bad so they chopped them off instead of saying it wasn't available.
ç¾é£Ÿå®‰æ…°äººå¿ƒ

I had gotten roast duck take out about two months ago.  After several hours the skin was still crunchy.  So I went again yesterday and ordered pi pa duck and chicken.  Both dishes are so disappointing.  It felt like they are from a different place or leftover from the day before.  I will not go back.
Good big portion of food, close at 8:30pm. Prices at $9.50 for rice orders
Huge portions, great food, insanely fast service. Neighborhood favorite
I don't understand why you have to force people to leave tips when they only ordered 1 thing and barely conversed with any of the waiters

Fantastic food, great price
We ordered the pecking duck to go and were very disappointed as it was mostly bones...Will not go back
I ordered fish congee, but the fish was bad, so I had to throw away the entire order. Highly not recommend.
One of the few places in the area that takes credit cards. Fast service and quality food with generous portions. Definitely hits the spot if you're craving a filling Cantonese lunch!
Quick lunch for me - nice
This is my regular Thursday spot they have the best pecking Duck ever!!!! Lovely  food and great staff over all
My go to place for cantonese style bbq and noodles

Cheap. Delicious. Wonton 8$ but huge portion
Food came out cold
Probably one of the better Chinese restaurants left in Chinatown.  The food is good, prices as reasonable as one can find these days.

Itâ€™s not an internet hot spot, but itâ€™s a local favorite. You can see people living in Chinatown eat there. They are very good at traditional Cantonese cuisine. Soy sauce duck and roasted pork are my favorites. The lunch special is a good deal. For less than $10, you can treat yourself a delicious meal.
Great Peking duck with Bao buns.   Steak was also very good.   Portions are enormous.
I found haven in NYC with fresh food on the table, come and have joy, yes chinese food
not recommended for bbq, very dry roasted pig and has lots of bones. there are definitely better places near by.

i have always loved the sign of this restaurant, we have been coming here for over 10 years.   We usually get the roasted meats.  There is a menu with 20 dollar portions of fried rice or general tso chicken.   i usually just stick to the roasted duck, soy sauce chicken or roasted pork with noodles, soup or rice.   portions are large, staff is friendly.

last time we were there, my son and i had roast pork, roasted duck and a large thing of congee with dried scallops for less than 20 bucks.  it was delicious

The WORST service in nyc, period. I know the tipping culture but if you asking for tips of your terrible service, culture becomes toxic.

I walked in this restaurant today. The waiters said â€œyou know you gotta leave tips if you dine here, right?â€ Itâ€™s not demure, not mindful, not cutesy. You should use your service to earn the tip instead of being rude to your customer. The crazier part is when I bout to leave tips. I think is one of the owner or managers. Heâ€™s walking around me and staring at me to see how much tips I left. The way you staring at me makes me feel disgusting.

DO YOURSELF A FAVOR,DONT COME. They donâ€™t deserve it.
rude
Love

Chinatown is not famous for it's atmosphere. This restaurant is good for inexpensive noting that everything has gone up. I was somewhat disappointed in the dish I had which was sour cabbage with chicken. There was one sour vegetable in the whole dish when compared to Squid with pickled vegetables, my all time favorite. But I noticed that their deli meats, BBQ pork, roast duck, soy sauce chicken with rice, noodles or in soup would be tastier.
Food was OK. Service was impersonal but fast. The congee was good. The duck was meh

2nd time. June 3, 2024.
Still great roasted duck and roasted pork.
Filet fish with tofu is great too.
We tried other dishes but they were just okay.

Authentic Chinese:) kind host. Really enjoy the food
One of the few places that takes card most places only accept money cheap and taste very good 10/10 would recommend
Bustling restaurant with very good rice dishes. I normally get their roast pork however their duck, chicken is equally delicious.
Our family of four happened into here during our road trip, and it was amazing!

The roasted duck here is incredible. Crispy skinâ€”as it should beâ€”and meaty, not full of bones like so many other canto bbqs.

They took a while to get around to me sometimes and didnâ€™t give me sauce w my takeout duck order, but otherwise, quick service and gave me sauce when I asked.

Canâ€™t wait to come back here to try their other food and get more duck! Standard affordable Chinatown prices :)
Bad feeling, poor service attitude, and salty food
Was all right, but pretty average
Restaurant chinois par excellence. Le canard, les vermicelles, la soupe de nouille, tout est trÃ¨s goÃ»teux. Le porc caramel trÃ¨s apprÃ©ciÃ© des enfants.
Ordered stir-fried lobster sautÃ©ed with ginger and scallions for the second time. Tasty.

The waiter was DEMANDING tips. I felt awful because I am European and I take 3-5 times less salary than these guys but he was demanding tips because he thought 3$ is not enough for a tip, where I am getting 6.5$ an hour where I work. This place is garbage and I am a tourist I didn't know that the tip is mandatory.

We visited Green Garden Village on 12/30/23 for my sonâ€™s 12th birthday celebration. My son loves Asian cuisine. He loves Chinese food. We tried duck for the first time and wow I was blown away. All of the food was delicious we ordered shrimp and steak fried rice, chicken and broccoli, mixed vegetables, lomein and duck. Our bill was only $80 (very reasonable). Our server was the only one on the floor, it was dinner time and was mighty busy. As a previous server, I understand how crazy it can be. Other than that, we had an awesome time and look forward to coming by! Friendly atmosphere.

My friend took me here on a Tuesday night for dinner and the place was moderately busy. It was my first time there, but we got the duck lo mein, pig, and ma po tofu and it was all delicious. For the amount of pig you get for the price point it is an absolute deal. The marinade for the pig was just delicious and everything felt cooked to perfection. The silk tofu used in the ma po was great, and everything felt very flavorful. The atmosphere here was great and I really enjoyed being there. Definitely get the pig!!!!

First time ordering and it was quite good with pricing and taste. Look at the Roast Pork, Char Siu and Roast Duck which has a nice glistening sheen on it and tasted delicious. Ordered one with three precious ingredients and one with two. A couple strands of Chinese style broccoli were added to help balance the roast delicacies. The rice was a bit dry and the free cup of soup that came with the order before sunset was cold. If I had ordered during lunch it would be much hotter.

It's hard to find a parking in Chinatown, somehow there was a spot, saw this restaurant.  Good google reviews, decided to try and order some takeout.   Had roast pork and roast pig, both good, Beef Chow Fun was good too.  House stir fryâ€¦

A great classic Cantonese spot in Chinatown. They have great Cantonese classic dishes with roast meats and chow mein. You canâ€™t go wrong with any of the dishes. The service is very Chinatown and you do need to sometimes ask for things as itâ€™s extremely busy most of the time

Great place to get lunch. I got shrimp rice roll (not sure if thatâ€™s what itâ€™s called because I ordered it by pointing at the picture), squid with black bean sauce, and sea bass with bean curd. Delicious. Great price. Will get food here again!
Soy sauce chicken is delicious.  I definitely go back for more.  Pork liver congee didn't have enough meat.   I had better congee from other restaurants in Chinatown.

Delicious food i got the three choice of meat I went with double duck and roast pork. It was very delicious and went very well with the rice.The prices are very reasonable just donâ€™t expect a top class service though. I asked the waitress for toothpick she told me to get it from the front haha Iâ€™ll def be back for more though

Best thing we like about this place?
The fact that the waiter was telling us that Peking Duck is overrated and weâ€™ll get a better value for money getting regular roast duck instead. I felt like somebody is looking out for us by giving us this advice - the roast duck was indeed very good!

My family really likes the pea tip stir fry too. Super fresh.

We ordered fish congee, roasted chicken and fried noodle here. All are tasty ğŸ˜‹

Quick and friendly service. We got free fortune cookies ğŸ¥ ğŸ™‚

Note:
To dine in ,prepare your vaccinations card.

Green Garden Villageâ€™s beef chow fun is probably the best Iâ€™ve had in the city. Beef chow fun should be stir fried â€œdryâ€ and full of flavor (very evident in the wok marks), without being too oily. Iâ€™ll definitely be coming back for more!

Green Garden Village is a casual dine-in and takeout Cantonese restaurant, located in Chinatown. there are several small and large tables spread out through the dining area. an older feel to this restaurant, but still clean and organized.

stopped in here to pick up takeout,  recently. wanted some comfort food and decided on getting siu yuk (roast pork belly), char siu (bbq pork) and roast duck over rice with a few piece of Chinese broccoli. the meats were seasoned well. the pork belly was crunchy and meaty, the bbq pork was sweet and savory, and the roast duck was rich meaty and juicy. the flavors soaked into the rice, making the dish so much more savory and flavorful. the portion was ample. the three bbq meats over rice costs $8â€“a great value.

the staff is quick and efficient.
The food was delicious.  Highly recommend the General Tso and the Beef & Oyster source, each with generous portions of fresh green vegetables like broccoli and snow peas
Amazing food. Very satisfying taste. Known for their seafood menu. Awesome deal on their seafood noodle soup. The interior could use some improvement.

Good take out if you're looking for affordable Chinese food. The BBQ meats over rice are huge portions. Not quite as fresh as Wah Fung's but there's no line to wait in. Lo mein wasnâ€™t what Iâ€™d expect.
Simply meh... the duck was not that flavorful,  too fat and had very few meat. By far one of the most meh I've ever had.
å¹³æ°‘é¤é¤¨ï¼Œå¦‚æœè¦æ±‚å””ä¿‚10åˆ†ä¹‹é«˜ï¼Œåƒ¹éŒ¢é£Ÿç‰©éƒ½å¯ä»¥ï¼Œä¸éŒ¯ï¼Œå¯ä»¥ä¸€è©¦ã€‚
Affordable and delicious Chinese roast dishes over rice. Decent Cantonese restaurant.
I will be dreaming about this pork belly until I can make it back to Chinatown...it was so crispy, almost chip like, and the meat was cooked perfectly. Very good food for such a reasonable price.

I enjoy this restaurant. It is a smaller restaurant but the food is good. I always get bbq pork or roast pork with rice. They have good prices and good food. The customer service is good as well. They are very friendly and accommodating.
Just bought a nice meal . Duck with rice and vegetables. Very delicious

Delicious and good price. I could smell the meat from outside and thatâ€™s what attracted me in.
You get half a roasted duck çƒ§é¸­ for 16 and a large amount of char siu å‰çƒ§ meat for only 12 a pound. Rice is 1.5. Both were delicious.
Service was very quick too, I ordered and in a couple of seconds I was walking out.

Food here is very good and the staff is friendly. Tried their wonton first and it was absolutely delicious. My mom said it was so good I told my friend who also said it was very good. My mom told my brother who bought an order home. My brother and wife and both also said it was really good! Tried other dishes such as pan fried noodles, beef chow fun with Gravy, fried rice, ma Po Tofu were all delicious. You can also get one, two or three choices over rice. I think the best to get is 3 choices. Definitely going back for more food!
This place is so, so good. Pay cash to have a small discount. The meat is not at all salty, just perfectly seasoned

I was in the bus and a Chinese passenger directed me to this place. They do not deliver, you can eat in and take out. Between 8:30am and 2:30 pm they have $8.30 special. I have a dish that the passenger indicated shrimp and vegetable. Fast service and was very fresh ( not many shrimps, but for $8 was pretty good. The duck nice portion for $10.00. then head around the corner for a small cheese cake $6.00 ( caramel one, or strawberry....they have many varieties and daily specials)
Great food and prices. I tried another place once and the next day I came back here as the quality was much better here. You wonâ€™t be disappointed.

Simple food, expertly prepared. This Chinese restaurant exceeded my expectations with its authentic flavors and culinary finesse. The roast pork, BBQ pig, and roast duck showcased the mastery of traditional cooking techniques, while the beef chow fun, clams with black bean sauce, and sautÃ©ed snow pea tips provided a diverse and satisfying dining experience.  I highly recommend giving this restaurant a visit.
